document_data.name: Vacuous Grimoire
document_data.mainbody: '''''Vacuous grimoires''''' were a type of ''[[cursed]]'' [[book]]s, or sometimes [[scroll]]s.
document_data.Description: Items ''cursed'' to become ''vacuous grimoires'' were indistinguishable from the mundane. When a ''vacuous grimoire'' was placed among other books, it instantly transformed to be indistinguishable from tomes surrounding it.

Abilities.Creation: A ''vacuous grimoire'' could be created by a capable crafter of wondrous items via application of the ''[[feeblemind]]'' spell.

document_data.History:
''Circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1367}}, a ''vacuous grimoire'' scroll could be found in the Master's Library of [[Krak al-Niraan]], the citadel of the [[Brotherhood of the True Flame]] in the [[Weeping Desert]].

''Circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1372}}, another cursed ''vacuous grimoire'' was disguised to be the second diary volume of Lord [[Ulguth Ilvastarr II]] of [[Waterdeep]]. Both tomes of the diary were hidden in the Ilvastarr family vault.
